resources.string: Pick a server for APK downloads.
If you are unable to remove the preinstalled fb apps.
If unable to remove the original messenger app.
If patched apps do not work after some time.
[Advanced] Allow third-party modules to be loaded.
[Advanced] Set a custom keystore file for apk signing.
Remove temporary files from the cache.
Visit the help forum to ask your question.
Visit the github repository of the project.

Enabling this option will allow you to install patched Messenger alongside the original FB apps, but may affect some functionality (opening links, login sharing etc). \nNormally, you should avoid this. It is intended for those who are unable to remove the original fb apps and facing issues while installing the patched apps.

This option is NOT recommended for regular users. It is intended for those who cannot remove the original messenger app. \nBe aware that enabling this option may affect some functionality and cause minor issues (ignorable). Please make every effort to remove the original Messenger before considering this option. \n[If you can remove the original Messenger app, you should check the \"Resolve apk conflicts\" option instead.]
Do you really want to enable fallback mode? \n[Apps patched in fallback mode may launch a little slowly]
WARNING: Fallback mode is currently enabled. If you didn\'t intend to enable it, please disable it from the settings tab.

Instructions: 

Uninstall all the official facebook apps: facebook, messenger, facebook lite, etc. 

Install the ChatHeadEnabler module. 

Patch and install a Messenger app from here. 

Please watch the video tutorial (from the app menu) for complete instructions. 

[Visit the help forum from the settings tab]

Troubleshoot: 

Download failed? 
Select different servers or try again later. 
Alternatively, you can download Messenger from apkmirror.com and patch it using the manual option. 

Install failed? 
Ensure you have uninstalled all the original fb apps. If some fb apps cannot be uninstalled, enable the "Resolve apk conflicts" option and try patching again. 

Not working? 
Ensure you have installed the ChatHeadEnabler module. Also, try restarting the Messenger app. 

Not working after a few days? 
Enable fallback mode and then patch again. 

[Visit the help forum from the settings tab]

Safety Note: 

Is it safe to use? 
Yes. It is safe, just like any other apps installed from the playstore. 
[Make sure you installed the MRVPatchManager from the official github link] 

How can I be sure it is safe? 
All the apps, tools and dependencies used here are open source, and you can find their source codes on github. 

What safety measures are taken? 
The manager downloads your selected app from the apk servers and verifies it against the original facebook signature, ensuring that you are patching an official Facebook app.
